title: Staff DevOps Analyst(Contractor)
content:
About Us
With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.
Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.
At ChargePoint, we foster a positive and productive work environment by committing to live our values of Be Courageous, Charge Together, Love our Customers, Operate with Openness, and Relentlessly Pursue Awesome. These values guide how we show up every day, align, and work together to build a brighter future for all of us.
Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.
Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.
Reports To
Manager, IT Cloud Infrastructure
What You Will Be Doing
The Cloud Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for deployment/management of ChargePoint Infrastructure to our Cloud Infrastructure in AWS. The deployment process will be developed by the DevOps team while considering all requirements. The team is responsible for keeping our service highly available, scalable, and well-performing across different regions of the world. The Cloud Infrastructure  Engineer should possess special responsibilities and skills for handling alerts 24/7 and responding promptly to errors, security threats, high-volume demand, and slow website.
What You Will Bring to ChargePoint

Deploy and manage Cloud Infrastructure in AWS (using Terraform/Terraform Cloud).
Provide technical leadership in establishing and guiding ChargePoint’s overall infrastructure processes, procedures, and methodologies to ensure best practices are in place and adhered by all IT staff.
Assist program management team in establishing software release schedules and ensure deployment timeline targets are met.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to debug and troubleshoot application issues.
Mentor new employees, perform technical interviews, and provide feedback and training as needed.

Requirements

3-7 years of total experience
2-4 years of experience in Cloud Services (AWS required, GCP would be a plus)
Terraform / Terraform Cloud IaC (Infrastructure as Code) platform
Linux (Amazon Linux 2.0, RedHat/CentOS based Linux, ubuntu advantage)
Linux scripting languages (bash / python)
Development methodologies (gitHub / Jenkins)
Docker containers and container orchestration tools (Kubernetes, docker swarm)
Okta Integrations (SAML2.0, provisioning applications) - using terraform okta provider would be a plus for integrations.
Optional/Preferred Skills:



DaaS / VDI (Amazon Workspaces, AppStream2.0, Nutanix, others a plus)
Automation technologies (Okta Workflows, Jira Workflows)


LocationGurgaon, India (Remote)
